amendment.description: Amendment withholds two percent of the State Department's funding for salaries and expenses until it releases its list of designated foreign terrorist groups as required by law.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 33 in the Congressional Record of September 16, 1997, to withhold two percent of the State Department's funding for salaries and expenses until it releases its list of designated foreign terrorist groups as required by the 1996 Antiterrorism and Effective Death Penalty

vote.text: On agreeing to the Gilman amendment (A019) Agreed to by recorded vote: 396 - 6, 5 Present (Roll no. 457).
